title: Numeric Types
text: Use int when you need to store a whole number without decimals, like 35 or 1000, and float or double when you need a floating point number (with decimals), like 9.99 or 3.14515.
A floating point number can also be a scientific number with an "e" to indicate the power of 10:

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
float f1 = 35e3;double d1 = 12E4;printf("%f\n", f1);
  printf("%lf", d1);
